text_result.title: Dacryoadenitis - MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> is most commonly due to viral or bacterial infection Common causes include mumps Epstein-Barr virus staphylococcus and gonococcus Chronic dacryoadenitis is usually due to noninfectious inflammatory disorders Examples include sarcoidosis<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> 			 				 Return to top If the cause of dacryoadenitis is a viral condition such as mumps simple rest and warm compresses may be all that is needed For other causes the treatment is specific to the causative disease Outlook Prognosis     			 			 	<strong>. . . </strong></li>
